definitions: The manner in which one conducts or carries oneself, including posture and gestures.
Relevance or relation of something to the matter at hand.
The act of supporting a weight or load.
The act of producing or yielding something, such as fruit or offspring.
The direction or position of something relative to a fixed point.
examples: His testimony had no bearing on the case.
The bridge was bearing the weight of heavy traffic.
The tree was bearing ripe apples.
We took a bearing on the distant lighthouse.
